patterns.title: Overwhelm and Boundaries
patterns.description: The patient frequently expresses feeling overwhelmed, particularly in work settings, and struggles with setting boundaries due to fear of being perceived negatively (e.g., 2025-01-12 entry).

patterns.title: Isolation and Fear of Rejection
patterns.description: There is a pattern of isolating behavior driven by fear of rejection, as seen in the reluctance to reach out to Sarah and the avoidance of the mother's call (e.g., 2025-01-13, 2025-01-16).

patterns.title: Coping with Panic and Anxiety
patterns.description: The patient experiences panic attacks and uses avoidance and concealment as coping mechanisms, such as hiding in the bathroom during a panic attack (e.g., 2025-01-15).

mood_trends.mood_shift: The mood appears to fluctuate with some positive interactions (e.g., conversation with Alex on 2025-01-17) amidst predominantly negative feelings of overwhelm and isolation.
mood_trends.notable_times: Mornings seem particularly challenging, as noted on 2025-01-14.

clinical_prompts: Explore the patient's fear of rejection and its impact on relationships.
Discuss the patient's experience with panic attacks and potential coping strategies.
Examine the patient's difficulty with setting boundaries and its relation to work stress.
Consider the patient's perception of normalcy and how it affects their mood.
Address the patient's feelings of guilt and how they relate to family dynamics.
strengths_observed: The patient recognizes small victories, such as making coffee despite feeling down.
Positive social interaction with a coworker provided a sense of normalcy.
concerns: The patient's increasing ability to hide panic attacks, which may prevent them from seeking help.
Persistent feelings of failure and heaviness, particularly in the mornings.
